info.official_title: Phase I Safety Assessment of Hypofractionated Postoperative Radiotherapy (H-PORT) for Intermediate-Risk Head and Neck Cancer
info.exclusion_criteria:
* Recurrence of the study cancer.
* History of systemic lupus erythematosus or systemic sclerosis (scleroderma).
* Pregnancy and individuals unwilling to discontinue nursing.
* Reliant on a feeding tube (gastric or jejuno) to maintain adequate nutrition at the time of registration
* Anticipated need for high-dose systemic chemotherapy (e.g., high dose q3-week cisplatin), multiple systemic therapy agents or immunotherapy. Weekly single-agent systemic therapy with cisplatin, carboplatin, or cetuximab is allowable.
* Prior radiotherapy to the region of the study cancer that would result in overlap of radiation therapy fields; prior chemotherapy for study cancer is not allowed.
* Per the operative and/or pathology report, positive margin(s) [defined as tumor present at the cut or inked edge of the tumor], nodal extracapsular extension, and/or gross residual disease after surgery; Note: Patients whose tumors had focally positive margins in the main specimen but negative margins from re-excised samples in the region of the positive margin are eligible.

inclusion_lines.line: Must have maximum age of 80 Years

criterions.exact_snippets: maximum age of 80 Years

inclusion_lines.line: * Lymphovascular invasion;

criterions.exact_snippets: Lymphovascular invasion

inclusion_lines.line: Must have minimum age of 18 Years

criterions.exact_snippets: minimum age of 18 Years

inclusion_lines.line: * The patient or a legally authorized representative must provide study-specific informed consent prior to study entry.

criterions.exact_snippets: The patient or a legally authorized representative must provide study-specific informed consent prior to study entry.

inclusion_lines.line: Healthy volunteers allowed

criterions.exact_snippets: Healthy volunteers allowed

inclusion_lines.line: * General history and physical examination prior to registration;

criterions.exact_snippets: General history and physical examination prior to registration

inclusion_lines.line: * Negative pregnancy test within 14 days prior to registration for participants who may become pregnant.

criterions.exact_snippets: Negative pregnancy test within 14 days prior to registration for participants who may become pregnant.

inclusion_lines.line: * Chest X-ray (at a minimum) or chest CT scan (with or without contrast) or PET/CT of chest (with or without contrast) prior to registration.

criterions.exact_snippets: Chest X-ray (at a minimum) ... prior to registration.
chest CT scan (with or without contrast) ... prior to registration.
PET/CT of chest (with or without contrast) ... prior to registration.

inclusion_lines.line: * Pathologically confirmed T3 or T4a primary tumor;

criterions.exact_snippets: Pathologically confirmed T3 or T4a primary tumor

inclusion_lines.line: * Patients with a prior or concurrent malignancy whose natural history or treatment does not have the potential to interfere with the safety assessment of the investigational regimen are eligible for this trial.

criterions.exact_snippets: Patients with a prior or concurrent malignancy
whose natural history or treatment does not have the potential to interfere with the safety assessment of the investigational regimen

requirements.requirement_type: potential to interfere with safety assessment of investigational regimen

inclusion_lines.line: * Clinical stage I-IVA squamous cell carcinoma of the oral cavity, oropharynx or larynx (AJCC 8th edition), including no distant metastases.

criterions.exact_snippets: Clinical stage I-IVA squamous cell carcinoma of the oral cavity, oropharynx or larynx (AJCC 8th edition)
including no distant metastases

inclusion_lines.line: * Total resection of the patient's cancer (i.e. no residual disease after total resection of the patient's cancer).

criterions.exact_snippets: Total resection of the patient's cancer (i.e. no residual disease after total resection of the patient's cancer)

inclusion_lines.line: * Single lymph node ≥ 3 cm or ≥ 2 lymph nodes (no extracapsular Extension);

criterions.exact_snippets: Single lymph node ≥ 3 cm
≥ 2 lymph nodes (no extracapsular Extension)

inclusion_lines.line: * Pathologically (histologically) proven diagnosis of squamous cell carcinoma (including variants such as verrucous carcinoma, spindle cell carcinoma, carcinoma NOS, etc.) of the head/neck (oral cavity, oropharynx or larynx); Note: Hypopharynx primaries are excluded because these patients have both a poor prognosis and high likelihood of post- radiation complications.

criterions.exact_snippets: Pathologically (histologically) proven diagnosis of squamous cell carcinoma (including variants such as verrucous carcinoma, spindle cell carcinoma, carcinoma NOS, etc.)
of the head/neck (oral cavity, oropharynx or larynx)
Hypopharynx primaries are excluded

inclusion_lines.line: * Perineural invasion;

criterions.exact_snippets: Perineural invasion

inclusion_lines.line: * One or more indications for postoperative radiotherapy, based upon pathologic findings:

criterions.exact_snippets: One or more indications for postoperative radiotherapy, based upon pathologic findings

inclusion_lines.line: * Zubrod Performance Status 0-1.

criterions.exact_snippets: Zubrod Performance Status 0-1

inclusion_lines.line: * T2 oral cavity cancer with ≥ 5 mm depth of invasion.

criterions.exact_snippets: T2 oral cavity cancer
≥ 5 mm depth of invasion

inclusion_lines.line: * Close margin(s) of resection (close margins defined as cancer extending to within 5 mm of a surgical margin);

criterions.exact_snippets: Close margin(s) of resection (close margins defined as cancer extending to within 5 mm of a surgical margin)

requirements.requirement_type: distance from cancer to surgical margin

nodal extracapsular extension
